document.topic_text: Tweet Starbucks Co. (NASDAQ:SBUX) ‘s stock had its “buy” rating restated by equities research analysts at Nomura in a report released on Monday, MarketBeat Ratings reports. In related news, Director Craig Weatherup sold 117,966 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction on Wednesday, January 27th. The shares were sold at an average price of $58.32, for a total transaction of $6,879,777.12. The sale was disclosed in a filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available at this hyperlink . Also, Director James G. Shennan, Jr. sold 20,000 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction on Monday, February 29th. The stock was sold at an average price of $59.00, for a total transaction of $1,180,000.00. Following the transaction, the director now owns 58,059 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $3,425,481. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . Several institutional investors have recently modified their holdings of SBUX. Brick & Kyle Associates increased its position in shares of Starbucks by 27.6% in the fourth quarter. Brick & Kyle Associates now owns 4,340 shares of the coffee company’s stock worth $261,000 after buying an additional 940 shares during the last quarter. Vicus Capital increased its position in shares of Starbucks by 13.2% in the first quarter. Vicus Capital now owns 4,444 shares of the coffee company’s stock worth $265,000 after buying an additional 517 shares during the last quarter. Financial Advisory Service Inc. increased its position in shares of Starbucks by 1.7% in the fourth quarter. Financial Advisory Service Inc. now owns 4,770 shares of the coffee company’s stock worth $286,000 after buying an additional 80 shares during the last quarter. Capital Investment Advisors increased its position in shares of Starbucks by 1.6% in the fourth quarter. Capital Investment Advisors now owns 4,829 shares of the coffee company’s stock worth $290,000 after buying an additional 76 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Capital Investment Advisors LLC increased its position in shares of Starbucks by 2.3% in the first quarter. Capital Investment Advisors LLC now owns 4,940 shares of the coffee company’s stock worth $295,000 after buying an additional 111 shares during the last quarter. Shares of Starbucks ( NASDAQ:SBUX ) traded up 0.0737% on Monday, reaching $57.7225. 5,553,002 shares of the company’s stock traded hands. The firm has a market capitalization of $85.32 billion and a P/E ratio of 35.4343. Starbucks has a 52 week low of $42.05 and a 52 week high of $64.00. The company’s 50-day moving average is $59.53 and its 200-day moving average is $59.72. Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) last issued its quarterly earnings results on Thursday, April 21st. The coffee company reported $0.39 EPS for the quarter, meeting analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.39. The firm had revenue of $5 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $5.02 billion. During the same period in the prior year, the company earned $0.33 EPS. The firm’s quarterly revenue was up 9.4% on a year-over-year basis. Equities research analysts anticipate that Starbucks will post $1.89 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. The firm also recently declared a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Friday, May 20th. Shareholders of record on Thursday, May 5th will be paid a $0.20 dividend. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Tuesday, May 3rd. This represents a $0.80 annualized dividend and a dividend yield of 1.38%. A number of other analysts have also recently issued reports on the company. Deutsche Bank reissued a “buy” rating and set a $70.00 price objective on shares of Starbucks in a report on Wednesday, January 20th. William Blair reissued a “buy” rating on shares of Starbucks in a report on Friday, January 22nd. Vetr cut Starbucks from a “strong-buy” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $66.03 price objective on the stock. in a report on Monday, January 18th. Jefferies Group increased their price objective on Starbucks from $66.00 to $68.09 and gave the stock a “buy” rating in a report on Tuesday, January 5th. Finally, BTIG Research reissued a “buy” rating and set a $75.00 price objective on shares of Starbucks in a report on Friday, January 22nd. Six research analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, twenty-one have issued a buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating to the company. The stock currently has an average rating of “Buy” and an average price target of $67.78. Starbucks Corporation is the roaster, marketer and retailer of specialty coffee. The Company purchases and roasts coffees that it sells, along with coffee, tea and other beverages, and a range of fresh food items, through Company-operated stores. It also sells a range of coffee and tea products and licenses its trademarks through other channels, such as licensed stores, grocery and national foodservice accounts. Receive News & Ratings for Starbucks Co. Starbucks Co.
